metadata.Title: CVE-2013-7393 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The daemonize.py module in Subversion 1.8.0 before 1.8.2 allows local usersto gain privileges via a symlink attack on the pid file created for (1)svnwcsub.py or (2) irkerbridge.py when the --pidfile option is used.  NOTE:this issue was SPLIT from CVE-2013-4262 based on different affectedversions (ADT3).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-7393` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-svn - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3
libapache2-svn - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3
libsvn-java - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3
libsvn-perl - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3
libsvn-ruby1.8 - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3
libsvn1 - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3
python-subversion - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3
ruby-svn - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3
subversion - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3
subversion-tools - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: subversion package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.8.8-1ubuntu3').
